subject: Data
title: Data Silos: When Information Can't Flow
description: Learn Data Silos: When Information Can't Flow in one minute.

hook.text: A hospital's billing system can't talk to its clinical system. The same patient exists in two worlds.

buildup.text: Data silos form when departments use incompatible systems, formats, or access rules.

discovery.text: Harvard Business Review found that data silos cost large enterprises an average of $12.9 million per year.

twist.text: Breaking silos isn't a technical problem. It's a political one â€” departments guard their data like territory.

climax.text: The promise of big data fails when the data can't be connected across organizational boundaries.

punchline.text: Big data's biggest enemy is the locked filing cabinet.
